required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Study on Glaucoma Surgery Using XEN® Gel Stent
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Study on Glaucoma Surgery Using XEN® Gel Stent

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of the XEN® Gel Stent in mild to moderate glaucoma patients undergoing glaucoma surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of the XEN® Gel Stent in mild to moderate glaucoma patients undergoing glaucoma surgery.
Follow-up period is 2 years.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Intraocular pressure, adverse events, complications, number of medications in mild to moderate glaucoma patients who underwent XEN® Gel Stent implantation were recorded. Data were collected in a 2 years follow-up.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (=Baseline=before surgery), after surgery on day 1, day 3, week 1, month 1, month 3, month 6, year 1, year 2
primary_outcome.description: Change in IOP before and after XEN® Gel Stent implantation

secondary_outcome.description: Number of needlings performed during the follow-up after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (=Baseline=before surgery), after surgery on day 1, day 3, week 1, month 1, month 3, month 6, year 1, year 2
secondary_outcome.description: Change in number of antiglaucomatous medications before and after the surgery.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Evolution of IOP after XEN® Gel Stent implantation
arm_group.description: To study the efficacy of the XEN® Gel Stent in lowering the IOP.

intervention.description: Minimally invasive glaucoma surgery (MIGS) which consists of implanting a XEN® Gel Stent in the irido-corneal angle of the eye to drain the aqueous humour in the sub-conjunctival space to lower the IOP.
intervention.arm_group_label: Evolution of IOP after XEN® Gel Stent implantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mild to moderate glaucoma patients
- Have given written informed consent
- Aged 18 years or older of either sex
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not able to understand the character of the study
- Participation in other clinical research within the last 4 weeks
- Patients with end-stage glaucoma
- Patients with glaucoma surgery done before
